member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase
member.summary: Provides .NET interface for PDT Image capture and processing.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.SysColorToDolphin(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Convert Color object to GrayScale (0-255)

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.VerifyExtension(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the extension specified to the filename specified if not already there and returns the new string.
member.param: Filename whose extension is to be verified
Extension to add.
member.returns: Filename with extension.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.Connect
member.summary: Connect to the Imager/Scan Engine.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnect from the Imager/Scan Engine.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.AdjustBrightness(System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply Brightness level to current image.
member.param: The brightness to be applied to the current image. The range is 0 to 100.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.AdjustContrast(System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply Contrast level to current image.
member.param: The contrast to be applied to the current image. The range is 0 to 100.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.AdjustThreshold(System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply Threshold level to current image.
member.param: The threshold to be applied to the current image. The range is 1 to 255.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.ApplyInfinityFilter
member.summary: This filter sharpens the current image by improving focus and contrast and makes any edges in the image sharper.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.AverageImage
member.summary: Apply Average algorithm to current image.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.ClearImage(System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Clear current image.
member.param: The color (Color object) to be applied to the background when the current image is cleared.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.CopyImage(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Copy the source image object into the internal image object.
member.param: A Device Independent Bitmap object to be copied to the internal image object.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.CopyImage(System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Copy the source image object into a new image object.
member.param: A Device Independent Bitmap object to receive the source image object.
A Device Independent Bitmap object to be copied to the specified destination image object.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.CropImage(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply Crop parameters to current image.
member.param: The left-most pixel value where the image should start.
The top-most pixel value where the image should start.
The width of the image being cropped.
The height of the image being cropped.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.DespeckleImage(System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Apply Despeckle algorithm to current image.
member.param: The threshold to be applied to the current image. The range is 0 to 8.
The color (Color object) to be applied to the background when the current image is processed.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.DitherImage(Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.DitherMode)
member.summary: Apply Dither level to current image.
member.param: The dither mode to be applied to the current image.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.FlipImage(Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.FlipMode)
member.summary: Flip the current image about specified axis.
member.param: Type of flip: Horizontal or Vertical
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.GetColorDepth
member.summary: Get Color Depth parameter for current image.
member.returns: The color depth being used.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.GetExposureField(Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField,System.Int32@)
member.summary: This function is used to retrieve a specific exposure field that is used during image acquisition.
member.param: Refer to the ImgExposureField enum definition.
An integer value that sets the specified field.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.GetImagerType
member.summary: This function gets the type of imager being used.
member.returns: The imager type, e.g.: IT4000, IT4200

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.GetImageBitCount
member.summary: This function gets the bit size of the current image.
member.returns: Bit count of current image.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.InvertImage
member.summary: Invert the current image.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.LoadFile(System.String,Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.SaveFormat)
member.summary: Load file using specified format.
member.param: The filename of the file being loaded into the internal image object. If this parameter is empty then the Filename property will be used instead.
The format of the file being loaded.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.OverlayWithBuffer(System.String,Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgAlignment,System.Int32,Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp)
member.summary: This function provides for overlaying a text string onto the current image.
member.param: The text string to be overlaid.
Where the text string should be displayed.
The height of the desired font.
Refer to RasterOp enum definition.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.OverlayWithTimeDate(Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgAlignment,System.Int32,Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp)
member.summary: This function provides for overlaying the time/date onto the current image.
member.param: Where the text string should be displayed.
The height of the desired font.
Refer to RasterOp enum definition.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.RankFilter(Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.FilterRank)
member.summary: Set Filter to specified value.
member.param: The rank of the filter being applied to the current image object.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.ResizeImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resize the current image using specified scale percentage.
member.param: The scale factor being applied to the current image object. The range is 5 to 100.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.SaveFile(System.String,Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.SaveFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Save file using specified format.
member.param: The filename of the file being saved from the internal image object. If this parameter is empty then the Filename property will be used instead.
The format of the file being saved.

The image quality factor. The range is 0 to 100. High quality values produce higher quality images with less compression. Lower quality values produce smaller image with more image data loss. This parameter is ignored for BMP and PNG files.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.SetColorDepth(Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ColorDepth)
member.summary: Apply Color Depth parameters to current image.
member.param: The color depth to be applied to the current image object.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.SetExposureField(Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function is used to set a specific exposure field that is used during image acquisition.
member.param: Refer to the ImgExposureField enum definition.
An integer value that sets the specified field.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.SetImageGammaCorrection(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the level used for Gamma correction on the current image. The gamma of an image is a measure of its contrast and brightness. By correcting the gamma, you can adjust these two elements in unison. Because this command can leave an image looking somewhat flat, you may want to increase the contrast after you have corrected the gamma.
member.param: The level to be used for Gamma correction.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.SharpenImage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply Sharpen algorithm to current image.
member.param: The sharpen value to be applied to the current image object. The range is 9 to 32.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.StretchHistogram
member.summary: Stretch Histogram for current image. If the Histogram does not cover the entire lightness spectrum, the image does not contain very dark or very light areas; it lacks contrast. The StretchHistogram command stretches the image closer to both ends so that it covers more of the spectrum.
member.returns: The result of the call to the image engine.

member.name: M:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImageBase.SetHDIBData(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: SetHDIBData

member.summary: Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the ScrollBarVert property when the scroll box is moved a large distance.

member.summary: Assignment of trigger key to initiate scanning or image capture.

member.summary: No trigger key assigned

member.summary: On\scan key to be used as trigger key

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.CBool
member.summary: Enumeration of BOOL type used in "C" interface

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.CBool.False
member.summary: False

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.CBool.True
member.summary: True

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ScrollBarsEnum.None
member.summary: Displays no scroll bars.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ScrollBarsEnum.Auto
member.summary: Displays, horizontal, vertical, or both scroll bars as necessary. Otherwise, no scroll bars are shown.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ScrollBarsEnum.Horizontal
member.summary: Displays only a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ScrollBarsEnum.Vertical
member.summary: Displays only a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ScrollBarsEnum.Both
member.summary: Displays both a horizontal and a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.SizeModeEnum.AutoSize
member.summary: The image is drawn as large as possible without clipping, while maintaining the original size ratio.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.SizeModeEnum.CenterImage
member.summary: The image is displayed in the center if the control is larger than the image. If the image is larger than the control, the picture is placed in the center of the control and the outside edges are clipped.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.SizeModeEnum.Normal
member.summary: The image is placed in the upper-left corner of the control. The image is clipped if it is larger than the control it is contained in.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.SizeModeEnum.StretchImage
member.summary: The image within the control is stretched or shrunk to fit the size of the control.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.SizeModeEnum.Zoom
member.summary: The size of the image is increased or decreased maintaining the size ratio.

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp
member.summary: Enumeration of Ternary raster operations

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.SRCCOPY
member.summary: Destination = Source

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.SRCPAINT
member.summary: Destination = Source OR Destination

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.SRCAND
member.summary: Destination = Source AND Destination

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.SRCINVERT
member.summary: Destination = Source XOR Destination

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.SRCERASE
member.summary: Destination = Source AND (NOT Destination)

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.NOTSRCCOPY
member.summary: Destination = (NOT Source)

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.NOTSRCERASE
member.summary: Destination = (NOT Source) AND (NOT Destination)

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.MERGECOPY
member.summary: Destination = (Source AND pattern)

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.MERGEPAINT
member.summary: Destination = (NOT Source) OR Destination

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.PATCOPY

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.PATPAINT

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.PATINVERT
member.summary: Destination = pattern XOR Destination

member.summary: Destination = (NOT Destination)

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.BLACKNESS
member.summary: Destination = BLACK

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.RasterOp.WHITENESS
member.summary: Destination = WHITE

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField
member.summary: Enumeration of exposure fields in the ExposureSettings structure.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_EXPOSURE_METHOD
member.summary: Type of exposure being selected (See ImgExposureMethod)

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_TARGET_VALUE
member.summary: The auto exposure algorithm tries to get a given percentile of all of the pixel values of the image, to fall at a target value. This parameter specifies the desired target value. The default value for this parameter is 150, with a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 255.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_TARGET_PERCENTILE
member.summary: The auto exposure algorithm tries to get a given percentile of all of the pixel values of the image, to fall at a certain value. This parameter sets where that percentile is in the image data. This value is configurable between 1 and 99, where 1 represents the darkest percentile of the image, and 99 represents the lightest percentile of the image.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_TARGET_ACCEPT_GAP
member.summary: This specifies how far the pixel value of the TargetPercentile can stray from the TargetValue but still be considered an acceptable image. The default value for this parameter is 10, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 50. It should be noted however that as this value gets smaller, the time to acquire a conforming image might be lengthened.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_MAX_EXP
member.summary: This specifies the maximum exposure value to be used by the auto exposure logic during image acquisition. The default value for this parameter is 1312, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 7874, in units of 127uS. It should be noted that this parameter would allow for the adjustment of the frame rate of the imager to achieve larger exposure times; therefore it will affect the speed at which the imager acquires an image.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_MAX_GAIN
member.summary: This specifies the maximum gain value to be used by the auto exposure logic during image acquisition. The default value for this parameter is 1, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 4.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_CONFORM_IMAGE
member.summary: Where the auto exposure software is always trying to get the TargetPercentile of pixel data to fall at the TargetValue, this parameter tells the image acquisition software that the acquired image must conform to the defined imager settings, (target percentile, target value, number of updates). The default value for this parameter is 0 for false, indicating that every image regardless of whether or not the target percentile of pixel values falls within the acceptance gap of the target value.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_CONFORM_TRIES
member.summary: This specifies the maximum number of attempts that the auto exposure logic can use while attempting to acquire an image that conforms to the target values set up for the auto exposure algorithm, before considering the image as conforming. This parameter is only valid when the ImageMustConform value is set to 1 or true. The default value for this parameter is 6, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 8.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_SPECULAR_EXCLUSION
member.summary: This parameter is no longer used by the image acquisition logic and should be set to 0.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_SPECULAR_SAT
member.summary: This parameter is no longer used by the image acquisition logic and should be set to 0.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_SPECULAR_LIMIT
member.summary: This parameter is no longer used by the image acquisition logic and should be set to 0.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_FIXED_EXP
member.summary: This is the exposure setting when the exposure mode is fixed. The default value for this parameter is 255, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 7874.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_FIXED_GAIN
member.summary: This is the gain setting when the exposure mode is fixed. The default value f or this parameter is 1, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 4.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureField.ES_FIXED_FRAME_RATE
member.summary: This is the frame rate setting when the exposure mode is fixed. The default value for this parameter is 30, the minimum value is 1 and the maximum value is 30.

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureMode
member.summary: Mode of exposure settings.

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureMode.SD_EXPOSURE_FIXED
member.summary: Fixed exposure mode

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureMode.SD_AUTOEXPOSURE_USE_HHP
member.summary: Hand Held Products exposure mode (default)

member.name: T:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureMethod
member.summary: Type of exposure being selected

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureMethod.AE_UNIFORM
member.summary: Uses all image data when calculating automatic exposure setting

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureMethod.AE_CENTER_ONLY
member.summary: Uses only the data in the center of the image when calculating automatic exposure setting

member.name: F:Honeywell.DataCollection.Imaging.ImgExposureMethod.AE_CENTER_WEIGHTED
member.summary: Uses all image data, but weights the data in the center of the image more heavily when calculating automatic exposure setting
